job_title: Vice President of Residential Services in Carmichael, CA
pros:
After working for many years with for-profit senior living companies, it has been refreshing to work with an organization that leads with heart and compassion for employees and seniors.  Eskaton is not motivated by profit guidelines or requirements.   Innovation is the central point of Eskaton and the company encourages creativity at every level of the organization.  Employees come first and it is common for the company to adopt new policies or practices based on line staff employee feedback.  
I come to work each day feeling inspired to take great care of staff and our residents.
cons:
The corporate offices are outdated and drab.  More modern office spaces encourage creativity, collaboration and inspire.   As we invite our employees, customers, prospective customers and others into our offices, the message our current space delivers is not impressive and speaks to an older and more traditional corporate organization.  Our motto is Transforming the Aging Experience, but our office says, we are old and stuck in the 80's.  
Although a physical plant is not more important than people, first impression and the overall esthetic is extremely important for our headquarters as well.

review_title: Management is horrible, making covid positive staff come to work.

Extremely understaffed and management does not care and leaves nurses to be working doubles almost every day.

job_title: Human Resources Specialist in Carmichael, CA
pros: I have worn MANY hats at Eskaton. When I first started , it was way back in 1990. I walked into the nearest Eskaton, which happened to be Eskaton American River Manor -A psychiatric hospital. I spoke with the Dietary Supervisor and walked out with a job, which at the time was desperately needed. Little did I know at the time, of the paths I would go down and where I would eventually end up. Over the last 28 years with Eskaton I have been a Cook, a Mental Health worker, a Receptionist, Administrative Assistant and now I am a HR Specialist. I have been down many roads all because Eskaton took a chance on me. Don't get me wrong I had a couple of jobs prior to Eskaton. But at this point they are all a blur.. it seems I have grown up with Eskaton. I have seen many changes - good and not so good over the years - but all in all Eskaton has been great place to work. And if you're looking to advance, this is the company. I am looking at retirement within the next few years - but I can say with all honesty this is the best company to work for. My life has taken many twist and turns, the one constant is Eskaton!
cons: None really comes to mind

pros: Coworkers and managers where great to work with
cons: Schedule changes, offten late night hours

review_title: Stepping stone to get into better companies
pros: If you're a new grad you will learn some skills in time management because you will be worked to the core.
cons: Poor management and lack of communication in leadership groups. High turn over rates. Director of Nursing position not constant. Guidelines lacking and morale low.

pros: overtime, great residents, okay coworkers
cons: run down building, not enough pay

pros: Nothing great about this place.

OVERWORKED. 
I felt like I was doing my supervisors job in memory care.

review_title: If you believe in bettering yourself, Eskaton believes in YOU
pros:
The Eskaton Executive Team believes in their staff and provides tools/resources for each employee to succeed. 
The Executive Team is open to feedback and communicates well internally/externally.
The organization engages employees to feel empowered by the mission of bettering the lives of older adults. 
Provides opportunities to experienced and capable employees to assume available roles within the organization as positions become available.
cons: Each Manager has a different leadership style and is not necessarily uniform across the board which can be challenging for some employees.

pros: Internal growth and opportunity, strong support of work/life balance, non profit organization, supportive management core throughout, comprehensive wellness program and opportunities for engaging wellness events and marathons provided by Eskaton, FUN committees, great medical, dental and vision benefits including chiropractic benefit coverage (which I use regularly and greatly appreciate- thank you!!) and so much more!
cons: I don’t have any cons to share. We work through normal business challenges together as a team and support is available to assist when we need it.

review_title: The interaction with residents is usually rewarding.
job_title: MEd Aide in Grass Valley, CA
pros: Helping others that need assistance. Letting people know they're still valid.
cons: It's a dead end job. There is no where to progress to.  Salaries are minimal and a single person cannot live on the wages so there is always a high turnover rate. The only reward is the interaction with the residents. Otherwise it's a thankless job with no reward.

job_title: Management Team Member At A Facility in Sacramento, CA
pros: Working with the residents and some of my coworkers. There are really good people at the facility and then there are some really interesting people that make you wonder how they ever got hired in the first place.
cons: The home office treats Managers like slaves. They are out of touch with how much work we do on a daily basis to pay their really high wages. Stop getting angry at us when we don't meet your exact deadlines. Why don't you  stop by and help us?

pros:
Amazing residents, I loved getting to know them and caring for them. The other Caregivers and Med Techs I worked with were for the most part absolutely fantastic and I felt that everyone truly cared about each other and the residents they cared for. They always did their best in terms of care and everyone was very quick to help each other during crazy and hectic times. Best coworkers I've ever had by far! Our head nurse at the time (Jackie) did a great job with the resources she was given and was very helpful and quick to answer questions and address concerns I had about resident care.

Being a caregiver is an incredibly rewarding and meaningful job, I always felt a great sense of accomplishment at the end of every shift. It is a great knowing that you impacted someones life in a positive way.
cons:
A few coworkers were lazy, unmotivated and would call off "sick" regularly which is completely unacceptable in my eyes. Often times we were unable to find another person to come in to fill that shift, so we'd be short staffed (only 3 caregivers for 45-55 residents). 
The AM shifts are insanely busy (and understaffed IMO) and  extremely stressful. The upper management never seemed to understand that a caregiver can only be in one place at one time. At any given time on a shift I had at least 10 things I had to do (change a diaper, turn someone in bed, check on this person, shower that person, etc, etc.) I'm not complaining about the work,  I just never felt like the upper management understood how swamped the care staff was.

The care staff is ridiculously underpaid and under appreciated for the amount of work they do. I made 10.40 hourly while working there.. I make much more now installing blinds, which is nowhere near as important as caring for people.  People flipping burgers at In n Out make more than that as well. The sad thing was, one of the best caregivers I worked with, who had been there for 5+ years, was still being paid less than me.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Fair Oaks, CA
pros: The experience of learning medical terminology.
cons: If you are not in a manager or supervisor position you honestly do not matter to this office, you are treated horrible, pay is horrible, and god forbid if you have a conversation with someone they will move your desk like in grade school but of coarse they can laugh hysterically and chat all day long. You call off one time be prepared to get written up or "talked to". Let's not forget the secret meetings they have about the office staff multiple times throughout the day.

pros: It is great working with the residents. Most of the staff I work with are wonderful. This facility is very beautiful.
cons: Low pay. I have been here 25 years and I am $2.00 an hour under what I should be making.  Eskaton adjusted their pay scale but did not bring any of us up to the amount we should have been at after not getting a raise for many years. It is very disheartening after being a loyal employee for so many years.

review_title: Really glad I work for Eskaton
job_title: Executive Director, Quality & Compliance in Carmichael, CA

cons: Always busy and staffing can be a challenge sometimes. It's harder when people call off. Sometimes family members can be challenging because they may not understand different levels of care.

review_title: Growing with the Best senior focused company

pros: The staff has your back. We work together as a team.

pros: Everyone is welcoming, you truly feel a part of the team. They value your opinion and strive to make a good work environment. cons: Pay could be better but it is the nature of the business unfortunately.

pros:

if a resident or coworker does like you, you can't really do anything about it.

review_title: Thankful for the mission and positive company culture of Eskaton

pros: Staff here are professional, passionate, friendly and respectful. Eskaton provides great trainings to enhance your skills and boost our morale.  Management always find ways to have fun team building activities that help us to get closer and work together.
